actions.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Finance.
Committee on Finance requested executive comment from OMB, Treasury Department, Health and Human Services Department.

official_title: A bill to amend title II of the Social Security Act to provide that no payments may be made under such title to inmates of penal institutions.
subjects: Old age, survivors and disability insurance
subjects_top_term: Old age, survivors and disability insurance

summary.text: Amends title II (Old Age, Survivors and Disability Insurance) of the Social Security Act to prohibit the payment of title II benefits to an incarcerated felon during any month of confinement. Treats the benefits withheld as having been paid to the felon for purposes of the payment of benefits to other persons so entitled on the basis of the wages and self-employment income of the felon. Requires that Federal, State, and local agencies make available to the Secretary of Health and Human Services, upon request, the names and social security numbers of any incarcerated felons under their jurisdiction.

titles.title: A bill to amend title II of the Social Security Act to provide that no payments may be made under such title to inmates of penal institutions.
